abstract: Special delivery (dir. John Weldon, Eunice Macaulay, 7 min, 1978)--Getting started (dir. Richard Condie, 12 min, 1979)--The Big Snit (dir. Richard Condie, 10 min, 1985)--Get a job (dir. Brad Caslor, 11 min, 1985)--The Cat came back (dir. Cordell Barker, 8 min, 1988)--Juke Bar (dir. Martin Barry, 11 min, 1989)--Blackfly (dir. Christopher Hinton, 5 min, 1991)--The Lump (dir. John F. Weldon, 8 min, 1991)
description: A compilation from the National Film Board of Canada spanning 20 years with eight short animation works using a variety of animation techniques. "Special delivery": Winner of the 1979 Academy Award for Best Animated Short this animation is about Alice and Ralph Phelps and their battle to solve the mystery of the dead mailman - a comic moral tale. "Getting started": An animation about procrastination as our hero attempts to practice on the piano but is constantly distracted. "The Big Snit": This award winning wacky film looks at two simultaneous conficts, the macrocosm of global nuclear war and the microcosm of a domestic quarrel and how each is resolved. "Get a job": Follow the tribulations of a cartoon character, Bob Dog, as he hunts for a job. "The Cat came back": Based on a century old folk song, Mr Johnson becomes increasingly manic as he tries and tries again to rid himself of a little yellow cat. "Juke Bar": A Juke Box is deliverd to a cafe and the cockroaches that infest the place jump and jive all night inside the 'Juke Bar' only to become trapped and removed in the morning. "Blackfly": A folk tune from 1949 about the prevalence of the black fly in northern Ontario brought to life through animation. "The Lump": Using a fun technique of recycled objects and photos of people's heads, this is the story of George; who although short and ugly, develops a lump on his head that has handsome human features which he uses for political gain - until corruption catches up with him. Some titles also available on VHS or 16mm [012927], [014401], [017344], [316221], [301087].
